poem:
### EU Mosaic

Ursula, brush in hand, paints  
an EU canvas—diverse  
yet so pale. Hope whispers  
in corridors, where Hadja  
stands. A single bead  
of color in Brussels' tapestry,  
woven tight. Threads of  
change, to unravel or  
embrace, as echoes of  
diversity dance in the quiet  
European halls.
